attributes.action: Move lorries from road to rail so no new crossing is needed over the Thames.
attributes.background: Save the beautiful view and habitat of the North Kent Thames Estuary threatened by the proposed East Thames Crossing by moving the lorries from road to rail, thus reducing existing Dartford Crossing usage by 10% and pollution by up to 80%.

rejection.details:
Transport for London are currently consulting on a new river crossing in East London and you can have your say using the following website: 

https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/rivercrossings/east-of-silvertown

Transport for London is accountable to the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: 

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
